  • Constructor Details

    • Condition

      public Condition​(String metricToEvaluate, int thresholdOperator, int thresholdValue)
      Building block of Rule. Represents a logic expression where the value of a metric is compared to a certain value, using the selected operation. For example, the condition "LOC_Class > 15", corresponds to the object Condition("LOC_Class", GREATER_THAN, 15)
      Parameters:
      metricToEvaluate - name of the metric that will be evaluated in this condition
      thresholdOperator - operator (greater/less than etc.) that will be used to compare metricToEvaluate with thresholdValue
      thresholdValue - value with which metricToEvaluate will be compared
      Since:
      1.0

  • Method Details

    • evaluateCondition

      public boolean evaluateCondition​(Line line) throws IllegalArgumentException, NumberFormatException
      Evaluates the expression represented in the condition, utilizing the values present in the specified line. The value for metricToEvaluate is obtained using HelperMethods.getCaseInsensitive(), a case insensitive equivalent to Map.get(K) for maps with String keys.
      Parameters:
      line - line containing the a map with the value corresponding to the key metricToEvaluate
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - if metricToEvaluate is not a key in the specified line's map or if the value corresponding to metricToEvaluate cannot be parsed to an int
      IllegalArgumentException - if the threshholdOperator in the condition is not valid i.e. not part of the constants
      See Also:
      HelperMethods.getCaseInsensitive(Map<String, V>, String)

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(Object obj)
      Compares the specified object with this condition. Returns true if the specified object is a condition with the same attributes as this condition. Compares metricToEvaluate, thresholdOperator and thresholdValue
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      obj - object to be compared for equality with this condition
      Returns:
      true if the specified object is a condition with the same attributes as this condition.
      See Also:
      Object.equals(Object)
